p: By increasing the temperature in the future, decade’s mortality will also increase. In Fig. 4, temperature, frequency (days) and number of mortality are shown for the observed period (a) and the future decades (b to f). In the observed period, max temperature was 43 °C, maximum frequency was recorded in 34 °C, and maximum mortality is seen at this temperature. For the future decades, in addition to the temperature increase the frequency of temperatures more than 26 °C (threshold temperature) has also increased which made the increase of mortality. Maximum increases will be seen for 2080–2090 such that the maximum estimation is 47 °C (e) which leads to the highest rate of mortality.
